alert.note: Alert for Western Mineral (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 06 at 11:45AM EST until January 07 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Isolated higher amounts of around 7 inches possible. * WHERE...In Maryland, Extreme Western Allegany County. In West Virginia, Western Mineral County. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 10 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening or Friday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected this evening when snowfall rates of 1 inch per hour are possible. Visibility will be reduced to near or less than one-quarter mile.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
